TopicTitle: Looking for someone to do KSP videos with

Articles.Content:
Hi i'm thinking about doing KSP videos and im looking for someone who would like to also

I would just want someone who has a sense of humour and is around my age, if you also need a mic (14 any one a couple of years older or younger is fine)

We could do challenges, KMP and all sorts of stuff

Just post your Skype name below or if your more private just PM me.

PS im in Australia

Edited February 26, 2014 by MSHalo3Rocks
I'd be interested but I don't know what time zone your. in. I also need to get Skype and I'll be 14 in a month.

I would apply but no Mic. So I guess I'm out

...Also don't have skype

I'd be interested but I don't know what time zone your. in. I also need to get Skype and I'll be 14 in a month.

In Australia ill update time zone

In Australia ill update time zone

Ah. Well I'm in GMT so that may be a problem
Australia, you say? Well, I live in India, so my timezone shouldn't be too off. I'm up for it. I'm a bit older though (17)

Australia, you say? Well, I live in India, so my timezone shouldn't be too off. I'm up for it. I'm a bit older though (17)

thats fine just PM me your skype name if you have a mic see ya soon

Ah. Well I'm in GMT so that may be a problem

Just PM me skype i play with people from america so you wont be as bad
I always wanted to play someone online on ksp. But Im in GTM + 1 (Poland) so i cant do that.

Wow so young!

Good on you for choosing such an emerging game, instead of a PEWPEWPEWDIEIDIEDIEBOOOOM like most FPS out these days.

I'm in Australia, and I've wanted to do something like this for a long time. But I'm very time poor at the moment. I am also 23.
I have started making videos myself. They're in KSP vanilla and kinda like Star Trek episodes. I could use some help. Called "Kerbal Federation" on YouTube. Any advice would be appreciated.

Wow so young! ... I am also 23.

Yeah? Guess how I feel ^^

Be cool kids, and watch how much real-life information you're giving away!

Kids can't bear to be seen doing anything "cool" with people twice their age. I'd have added "these days" to that sentence, but really, that's been the case for as long as anyone can remember. I sometimes try to remember when it was that I stopped caring about the age differences and realized that fun is fun no matter how old the people involved are. Then I get a bit bummed at the fact that the number that comes up is close to half my life ago.
Yeah I just turned 33 myself. Got a stressful job and Kerbal is just the thing to help me unwind when the wife and baby go to sleep.
